TextAsset.value: Ah, ${slot:playerName}. I’m glad you could make it.
What were you doing in the dark, Al?
You can’t read in the dark!
(Ah, so another criminal justice club meeting?)
My rights? You got nuthin’ on me, N.A.R.C.!
(Ha! That sounded pretty good! If I didn’t know any better, I might think I’m a criminal.)
We can do this the hard way or the easy way.
(Do they say copper? Is that good slang?)
I didn’t want to have to do this, but…
YOU LEAVE ME NO OTHER CHOICE!
Our agents have been tailing you for days. We know all about your vast criminal empire that you’ve expertly made to look exactly like the routine of a perfectly innocent Namco High student.
Those are just pictures of me walking to class.
I’m using the drinking fountain in this one.
(And I look kinda cute in it too!)
This one is me sitting down at this table.

And this one is appears to be an artist’s rendering of me selling crates full of “ammo hack cheat codes” to a gang of olde timey bank robbers, some banditos, what appears to be a vampire king, and a skeleton in a cape?
That’s Emperor Dracula and Super Skeleton.
They’re the main bad guys in my fanfic.
And I’m not sure how that got in with those...
Anyway. Besides that stuff, there’s even more evidence!
(Well, whatever, it sounds the same! He’ll never know which one I meant!)
Ha! The sweet irony of it all. Everything you say digs you that much deeper.
If you aren’t a big old crime kingpin, then why do you keep using criminal slang?
(I’m playing the part of the criminal for this mock interrogation, so I’ve got to talk like a criminal.)
(But if I was being interrogated for real, I couldn’t say that.)
I watch a lot of old gangster movies.
Perhaps you would care to explain why you repeatedly thwarted the undercover operations of the top agents of the world’s top crime fighting agency?
Or do you expect us to believe that was all a big misunderstanding?
(Wow, I must be playing the part of some kinda international crime genius!)
(Kind of ambitious for a high school club...)
Are you telling me my crime is that you can’t figure out if I did a crime?
That hardly seems fair, Officer Tross.
(Oh, man. Really feel like I’m nailing this part.)
(Maybe I should’ve joined the Drama Club!)
You defeated the World Crime Police Organization.
I don’t think you appreciate the depth of this reveal.
This would be the moment where, if I was wearing a mask, I’d take it off.
That’d probably help you process how dramatic it is right now.
Are we still doing the mock interrogation?
We don’t have a case against you. You’ve defeated our every effort to build one.
I’m not ORDINARY STUDENT Alfonso “Al” B. Tross of the N.A.R.C. club.
I’ve been on a sting operation to crack down on the cheat code trafficking ring centered on Namco High.
Our intel put you at the center of that ring.
You were lying to me all along?
At first I was merely collecting evidence to use against you.
I almost fell for the ${slot:playerName} you pretend to be.
That persona you hide behind to mastermind all the cheat code crimes in Namco Land with impunity!
I only pretended to know about cheat codes or whatever because I thought it was part of the criminal justice club!
I, uh, you got the wrong person. I’m just a student.
Heck, I’m new here! I don’t know enough people in school to organize a vast student criminal empire.
If the mission parameters were wrong from the start, then the operation’s failure isn’t on my shoulders!
And, more importantly, I wasn’t outsmarted by a high school student!
But, sort of, you totally were.
(Ack! I should’ve said that to myself.)
Um, were you really falling for me though?
Anyway, I don’t even go to this high school anymore.
You used to be a student here?
Of course. It’s why I was selected for this operation.
I came back under the completely plausible but false identity of ALFONSO “AL” B. TROSS.
So...you’re not much older than me…?
(Oh, man. Am I gonna go for it?)
(Is this even the right time to go for it?)
(But what if I wait too long!)
The cheat code kingpin is still out there. Somewhere.
Guess I’ve still got a lot to learn about being a superspy…
I must look like a complete idiot and nothing like an incredibly dashing hero who saved the world once.
Maybe it’s time to face the facts.
I’m not cut out for this dangerous game of undercover cat and mouse where you infiltrate the mouse hole to get to the head mouse behind all the cheese smuggling.
And then, uh, eat that mouse?
How do you work arresting into this metaphor?
The cheat code kingpin has won.
Because I’m giving up the case.
I AM A SECRET AGENT NO MORE!
You’re really good at agent-ing around!
If that were true, I would’ve captured the cheat coder by now!
Not even you can talk me out of it, Pac-Man.
I hereby renounce being a really cool spy!
I’m gonna get some shabby clothes!
And not style my hair at all.
You can’t do any of that.
I might enjoy looking like a slob. And not going on adventures.
And not saving the world and looking great while I do it.
It might not be the living nightmare it sounds like!
It might actually be the best!
But if you do all that, you’ll become a gross guy with no confidence instead of the suave man of action I fell for!
I’m not sure how I feel about that…
But I know I could never interest someone like ${slot:playerName} if I thought so little of myself that I’d go around in public with a neckbeard and unwashed hair!
I AM ALBATROSS! THE BEST SECRET AGENT IN THE ENTIRE WORLD CRIME POLICE ORGANIZATION!
Well, but that’s twice now you’ve yelled about it.
Not too sure how secret it is anymore.
I’ll have to work on that.
Being true to myself is great!
You were a fool to doubt me.
